primary_phone.department: Parking Violations Bureau / LA County Parking Enforcement
primary_phone.purpose: Confirm Phase-1 appeal mailing addresses and issuing authority routing.

sections.authority_name: Los Angeles Department of Transportation Parking Violations Bureau

serves.description: Most parking citations issued within the City of Los Angeles are processed through the LADOT Parking Violations Bureau.

how_to_recognize.notes: Citation number appears on the ticket and online payment portal; may contain up to 11 alphanumeric characters.

submission_methods.notes: Initial reviews may be requested by web, mail, phone or in-person; mailing address requires a letter explaining why the citation should be dismissed.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm this is the correct mailing address for your initial review request or to verify that your citation routes to LADOT.

verification.verified_source_note: Mailing address and instructions confirmed on LADOT PVB correspondence and mail-in payment pages.

serves.description: Citations issued by LAPD parking enforcement or officers may list the department but are processed through the LADOT Parking Violations Bureau.

how_to_recognize.notes: Often handwritten or printed by LAPD officers; may route to LADOT for processing.

submission_methods.notes: Citations issued by LAPD must be appealed through the Parking Violations Bureau; LAPD does not accept direct appeals.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm that LAPD-issued parking citations route to the LADOT Parking Violations Bureau for initial review.

verification.verified_source_note: Must confirm whether LAPD parking citations always route to LADOT PVB; official confirmation required.

sections.authority_name: University of California, Los Angeles Transportation Services

serves.description: Parking citations issued on the UCLA campus by UCLA Parking Services.

how_to_recognize.notes: Issued on UCLA property; citation includes campus-specific codes.

submission_methods.notes: All citation appeals must be completed online through pticket.ucla.edu; no mail or in-person option is available.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: UCLA requires that all parking citation appeals be filed online; no mailing address is provided for initial review.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm procedure for contesting UCLA parking citations and whether any mailing address exists.

verification.verified_source_note: UCLA Transportation site states that all appeals must be submitted online; no mailing address listed.

sections.authority_name: University of Southern California Transportation Services

serves.description: Citations issued by USC Transportation on university property.

how_to_recognize.notes: Citation numbers can be looked up using your USCID or cell phone number.

submission_methods.notes: All citation appeals must be completed online via USC Transportation portal within 21 days.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: USC Transportation requires appeals to be submitted online; no mailing address is provided for initial review.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm procedure for contesting USC parking citations and confirm no mail-in option.

verification.verified_source_note: USC Transportation appeal page states all appeals must be completed online; contact details provided.

serves.description: Parking citations issued on the Cal State LA campus.

how_to_recognize.notes: Citations display Cal State LA branding; number appears near the barcode.

submission_methods.notes: Initial review requests can be submitted online via the AIMS portal or by mailing a contest form.

appeal_mail_to.address1: 5151 State University Drive, Public Safety Building

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm mailing address for contesting Cal State LA parking citations.

verification.verified_source_note: Cal State LA Parking citation information page lists mailing address for contest forms and online submission instructions.

sections.authority_name: Los Angeles County Parking Enforcement Detail

serves.description: Parking citations issued in unincorporated areas of Los Angeles County or by County agencies, processed by LA County Parking Enforcement Detail.

how_to_recognize.notes: Citation numbers appear near the top of the notice; LA County citations may reference LASD (Los Angeles County Sheriffâ€™s Department).

submission_methods.notes: To contest a citation, you must write to the Parking Enforcement Detail or visit a Public Service Center.

appeal_mail_to.department: County of Los Angeles Parking Enforcement Detail

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm the mailing address and process for contesting LA County parking citations.

verification.verified_source_note: PDF FAQ from LA County Parking Enforcement Detail lists mailing address for payments and contest requests.

sections.authority_name: Los Angeles County Metropolitan Transportation Authority (Metro) Transit Court

serves.description: Parking and fare citations issued by Metro at transit stations or facilities.

how_to_recognize.notes: Citations include a leading 'T' or 'P' followed by digits; used for Metro transit or parking violations.

method_constraints: Include the letter 'T' or 'P' when entering citation number online
submission_methods.notes: Online portal allows you to pay or contest citations; correspondence and initial review requests may be mailed.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm mailing address and procedures for contesting Metro parking or transit citations.

verification.verified_source_note: Pasadena Now article reports Metro Transit Court address and indicates that correspondence may be sent there; official site not accessible.

blocking_issues: Need confirmation whether LAPD parking citations always route to LADOT PVB.
Metro Transit Court mailing address and procedures not confirmed via an official source.
known_gaps: UCLA section missing confirmed mailing address for Phase-1 protests.
USC section missing confirmed mailing address for Phase-1 protests.
Citation patterns for LADOT, LA County, Metro and campus authorities are approximate and require verification.
